newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile shares end soft, dragged down by Enersis.
newsitem.headline: Chile shares end soft, dragged down by Enersis.

text.p: Chilean blue chips closed sharply lower with the bolsa pulled down by a slide in the Enersis group which had rallied last week ahead of a deal with Spanish utility Endesa, said traders.
Traders said they expected the bourse to find its footing at the opening and could end the day slightly firmer, unless the Enersis group suffer a further price correction.
The 40-share .IPSA index ended unofficially down 1.39 percent at 134.01 points. The general .IGPA index slipped 0.9 percent to 5,691.83 points amid turnover of 14 billion pesos.
Traders noted a sharp fall in the Chispa group of companies, which control Enersis, as speculators sold stock following the announcement in the media of the terms of Endesa's offer for these stocks.
Speculators sold the Chispas once they realized that Endesa would stick to its position of only buying shares owned by investors on May 30, they said.
Enersis and subsidiary Endesa lost ground on a wave of sell orders in New York in late afternoon trade, said brokers.
"People are still analyzing to see what the Endesa deal means for Enersis now the position with the Chispas is clear," said one dealer.
Enersis slumped 2.24 percent to 305 pesos, while Endesa shed 2.45 percent to 319 pesos.
Winners included drug-maker LabChile, up 1.59 percent at 640 pesos and Banco Edwards which firmed 1.48 percent to 52 pesos.
